Hi Dean, yes I agree, it's a brilliant job. One thing I would suggest is 
getting a little smarter with your photos as the page takes a long time 
to load. I down loaded one photo and it is 2.3 meg. Given that there are 
many images there it will slow down the loading considerably and also 
eat into peoples bandwith depending on their connection speeds.

There are some easy ways to alleviate this and if you would like to 
discuss them please just let me know. I would be happy to help you.

Cheers

Richard Turner


On 13/09/2010 3:20 AM, lorrez_d wrote:
>
> Amazing work you're doing there ! If you need a hand with structuring 
> this thing, perhaps we can buy a new domain and put a nice structure 
> into it so it's more easy to navigate ?
>
> Let me know if you need any help with this..
>
> And thanks for the effort you put into this project !
>
> Dave
>
> --- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
> <mailto:nihontostudy%40yahoogroups.com>, "Dean" <dshartley3@...> wrote:
> >
> > I'm improving the Col Dean Hartley Website, specifically the page on 
> the 1964 Barnsdall Sword Show put on by the Nanka Token Kai 
> (http://home.comcast.net/~colhartley/Oriental/ArmsAndArmor.htm 
> <http://home.comcast.net/%7Ecolhartley/Oriental/ArmsAndArmor.htm>). I 
> am looking for additional photos of the exhibit itself (the catalog 
> pictures are already on the page). Fred Martin and Bob Haynes just 
> about killed themselves putting on a fantastic show and I want it to 
> remain possible for those who weren't there to enjoy it.
> >
>
>
